Characteristics.Name: Age
Characteristics.Description: Usually recorded as date of birth

Characteristics.Name: Sex
Characteristics.Description: Sex (M/F) is asked for, gender not usually collected.

Characteristics.Name: Gender reassignment
Characteristics.Description: There are strict rules for collecting this data and it must be held in a way that it cannot be seen by anyone not directly involved in patient care.

Characteristics.Name: Marriage/Civil partnership
Characteristics.Description: Not usually asked for, unless relevant to patient care and support.

Characteristics.Name: Disability
Characteristics.Description: How and when this is collected varies across the system, patients may not identify with being disabled.

Characteristics.Name: Race
Characteristics.Description: Wouldnâ€™t ask about Race in health settings, would ask patient for their ethnicity.

Characteristics.Name: Pregnancy/Maternity
Characteristics.Description: Not a census question but commonly asked in health settings, often in the format, â€˜Are you currently pregnant or breastfeeding?â€™.

Options: Female (including male to female trans women)
Male (including female to male trans men)
